standard rejection letter. email to view decision in portal. 

Thank you for your interest in the Department of Brain and Cognitive Sciences at MIT. After careful review of your application, we regret to inform you that we are unable to offer you admission to our program for the upcoming academic year. This decision reflects the exceptionally competitive nature of this year’s admissions cycle.

We truly appreciate the time and effort you invested in your application and the opportunity to learn more about your background, achievements, and goals. The Admissions Committee recognizes the strength of your record and the dedication you have shown to your academic and professional development.

We understand that this news may be disappointing. Please know that this decision was based on the volume of outstanding applicants rather than any lack of merit on your part.

As you move forward, we encourage you to continue pursuing your goals with the same commitment and enthusiasm that led you to apply to our program. We wish you every success in your future endeavors.

Thank you again for your interest in the Department of Brain and Cognitive Sciences.

Sincerely,



Matt Wilson signature

Matthew A. Wilson, Ph.D.
Chair, Graduate Admissions Committee
Department of Brain and Cognitive Sciences
Massachusetts Institute of Technology
Building 46 Room 5233
77 Massachusetts Avenue
Cambridge, MA 02139

GPA is from my current Double MA program. Applied with the intent to pursue the Language Acquisition track. I have presented at over 10 conferences, 2 papers accepted for publication, held leadership roles, and received departmental awards. Got an email to review a "Decision Letter" in the application portal. Message: The review of your application to the graduate program below has been completed. We regret to inform you that, after careful evaluation and consideration, it is not possible to offer you admission to McGill University for the Fall / Automne 2026 term.

Program: PhD in Educational Studies (Thesis)
Department: Integrated Studies in Ed / Études intégrées en éducation

Admission to graduate programs at McGill University is highly competitive and the number of strong applications often exceeds the number of spaces available. Accordingly, I must advise you that admission decisions are not subject to reconsideration or appeal.

Please note that if you have applied to another program or programs at McGill, you will receive a separate response for each program.

We regret the disappointment this will cause you and wish you much success in your future endeavours.

Fingers crossed for the rest of this cycle...

The Illinois English Department has completed its graduate admissions deliberations, and I am indeed sorry to report that we will not be able to offer you admission for the 2026-2027 academic year. This decision should not be taken as a sign that our readers did not enjoy reading your work: due to this year's budgetary restrictions, we have been unable to admit dozens of candidates who could thrive at the graduate level. In the end, we admitted fewer than 10% of the applicants for graduate study in our department, making this an especially competitive admissions cycle. 
We hope that you will be able to pursue your goals for advanced study in another context, and we wish you the very best success in your scholarly or creative endeavors. Many thanks for your interest in our program, and for all of the time and energy that you put into your application.

The Creative Writing MFA Program at the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign has now completed its graduate admissions deliberations, and I am indeed sorry to report that we will not be able to offer you admission for the 2026-2027 academic year.
